intro: Malapoenna varians, commonly known as the variable malapoenna, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
